CodeList.Name: Concomitant Medication Dose Form

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Pharmaceutical Dosage Form codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Form codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A product that is packaged under pressure and contains therapeutically active ingredients that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system; it is intended for topical application to the skin as well as local application into the nose (nasal aerosols), mouth (lingual aerosols), or lungs (inhalation aerosols).

A solid pharmaceutical dosage form that contains medicinal agent within either a hard or soft soluble container or shell, usually used for the oral administration of medicine. The shells are made of a suitable form of gelatin or other substance. (NCI)
A semisolid emulsion of either the oil-in-water or the water-in-oil type, ordinarily intended for topical use. (NCI)
Any elastic aeriform fluid in which the molecules are separated from one another and have free paths. (NCI)

A semisolid (1) dosage form that contains a gelling agent to provide stiffness to a solution or a colloidal dispersion (2). A gel may contain suspended particles. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: A colloidal dispersion is a system in which particles of colloidal dimension (i.e., typically between 1 nm and 1 micrometer) are distributed uniformly throughout a liquid.

A suspension or emulsion, semisolid (1) dosage form, usually containing less than 20 percent water and volatiles (2) and greater than 50 percent hydrocarbons, waxes, or polyols as the vehicle. This dosage form is generally for external application to the skin or mucous membranes. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: Percent water and volatiles are measured by a loss on drying test in which the sample is heated at 105 degrees C until constant weight is achieved.

A drug delivery system that often contains an adhesive backing that is usually applied to an external site on the body. Its ingredients either passively diffuse from, or are actively transported from, some portion of the patch. Depending upon the patch, the ingredients are either delivered to the outer surface of the body or into the body. A patch is sometimes synonymous with the terms Extended Release Film and System.
An intimate mixture of dry, finely divided drugs and/or chemicals that may be intended for internal or external use. (NCI)
A liquid minutely divided as by a jet of air or steam. (NCI)
A solid body of various weights and shapes, adapted for introduction into the rectal, vaginal, or urethral orifice of the human body; they usually melt, soften, or dissolve at body temperature.

A liquid dosage form that contains solid particles dispersed in a liquid vehicle. Note: A liquid is pourable; it flows and conforms to its container at room temperature. It displays Newtonian or pseudoplastic flow behavior.
A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents. (NCI)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Form Terminology

CodeList.Name: Concomitant Medication Dose Units

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Units codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A dosing measurement based on the capsule unit.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a kilogram, the kilogram being the base unit of mass in the International System of Units (SI).

The unitage assigned by the WHO (World Health Organization) to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization, to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a gram.
A unit of volume equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a liter.

A means of delivering a defined dose of a therapeutic aerolized solution into either the upper or lower respiratory tract. Metered-dose inhalers or spray pumps are devices that provide a puff dose for delivery into either the oral or the nasal cavity.(NCI)
A dosing measurement based on the tablet unit.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one millionth (1E-6) of a gram.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dose Units Terminology

CodeList.Name: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Frequency codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Two times per day, at unspecified times. (NCI)
As needed. (NCI)
A rate of occurrences within a period of time equal to one day.
Four times per day. (NCI)
Every month. (NCI)
Every other day. (NCI)
Three times per day. (NCI)
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Dosing Frequency per Interval Terminology

CodeList.Name: Concomitant Medication Route of Administration

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Route codelist created for CDASH Concomitant Medication Route of Administration codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Administration within or introduced directly into a localized lesion. (FDA)
Administration within a muscle. (FDA)
Administration within the eye. (FDA)
Administration within the peritoneal cavity. (FDA)
Administration to the nose; administered by way of the nose. (FDA)
Administration to or by way of the mouth. (FDA)
Administration to the rectum. (FDA)
Administration within the respiratory tract by inhaling orally or nasally for local or systemic effect. (FDA)
Administration beneath the skin; hypodermic. Synonymous with the term SUBDERMAL. (FDA)
Administration to a particular spot on the outer surface of the body. The E2B term TRANSMAMMARY is a subset of the term TOPICAL. (FDA)
Administration through the dermal layer of the skin to the systemic circulation by diffusion. (FDA)
Administration into the vagina. (FDA)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Concomitant Medication Route of Administration Terminology

CodeList.Name: ECG Original Units

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH ECG Original Units codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time. (NCI)
A unit of time, which is equal to one thousandth of a second.(NCI)

The base unit of time in the International System of Units (SI) equal to the duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the cesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH ECG Original Units Terminology

CodeList.Name: Ethnicity As Collected

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist relevant to the ethnicity of an individual as collected on the case report form.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A Chinese person from the Achang ethnic group.
A person of Ashkenazi Jewish descent.
A Chinese person from the Bai ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Blang ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Bonan ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Buyei ethnic group.
A person of Central American descent.
A Chinese person from the Chosen ethnic group.
A person of Cuban and American descent.
A person of Cuban descent.
A Chinese person from the Dai (including several different Tai-speaking groups historically referred to as Bai-yi) ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Daur ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Deang ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Derung ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Dong ethnic group.

A Chinese person from the Ewenki ethnic group.

A Chinese person from the Gin ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Han ethnic group (including Chuanqing).
A Chinese person from the Hani (including Sangkong) ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Hezhen ethnic group.
A person of Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Central or South American or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race. (NCI)
A Chinese person from the Hui (including Utsuls of Hainan, descended from Cham refugees) ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Jingpo ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Jino ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Kazak ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Kirgiz ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Lahu ethnic group.
A person of Latin American descent.
A Chinese person from the Lhoba ethnic group.

A Chinese person from the Lisu ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Man ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Maonan (including the Then) ethnic group.
A person of Mexican and American descent.
A person of Mexican descent.
A Chinese person from the Miao (Including Hmong) ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Monba ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Mongol ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Mulao (including the Qago) ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Naxi (including Mosuo) ethnic group.
A person not of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race. An arbitrary ethnic classification. (NCI)
Not provided or available.
A Chinese person from the Nu ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Oroqen ethnic group.
A person of Puerto Rican descent.
A Chinese person from the Pumi ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Qiang ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Russ ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Salar ethnic group.
A person of Sephardic Jewish descent.
A Chinese person from the She ethnic group.
A person of South American descent.
A person from Spain or of Spanish descent.
A Chinese person from the Sui ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Tajik ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Tatar ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Tu ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Tujia ethnic group.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)
A Chinese person from the Uygur ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Uzbek ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Va ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Xibe ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Yao ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Yi ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Yugur ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Zang (including Amdowa, Khampa and some Pumi speakers) ethnic group.
A Chinese person from the Zhuang ethnic group.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Collected Ethnicity Terminology

CodeList.Name: Exposure Dose Form

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Pharmaceutical Dosage Form codelist created for CDASH Exposure Dose Form codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A product that is packaged under pressure and contains therapeutically active ingredients that are released upon activation of an appropriate valve system; it is intended for topical application to the skin as well as local application into the nose (nasal aerosols), mouth (lingual aerosols), or lungs (inhalation aerosols).

A solid pharmaceutical dosage form that contains medicinal agent within either a hard or soft soluble container or shell, usually used for the oral administration of medicine. The shells are made of a suitable form of gelatin or other substance. (NCI)
A semisolid emulsion of either the oil-in-water or the water-in-oil type, ordinarily intended for topical use. (NCI)
Any elastic aeriform fluid in which the molecules are separated from one another and have free paths. (NCI)

A semisolid (1) dosage form that contains a gelling agent to provide stiffness to a solution or a colloidal dispersion (2). A gel may contain suspended particles. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: A colloidal dispersion is a system in which particles of colloidal dimension (i.e., typically between 1 nm and 1 micrometer) are distributed uniformly throughout a liquid.

A suspension or emulsion, semisolid (1) dosage form, usually containing less than 20 percent water and volatiles (2) and greater than 50 percent hydrocarbons, waxes, or polyols as the vehicle. This dosage form is generally for external application to the skin or mucous membranes. Note 1: A semisolid is not pourable; it does not flow or conform to its container at room temperature. It does not flow at low shear stress and generally exhibits plastic flow behavior. Note 2: Percent water and volatiles are measured by a loss on drying test in which the sample is heated at 105 degrees C until constant weight is achieved.

A drug delivery system that often contains an adhesive backing that is usually applied to an external site on the body. Its ingredients either passively diffuse from, or are actively transported from, some portion of the patch. Depending upon the patch, the ingredients are either delivered to the outer surface of the body or into the body. A patch is sometimes synonymous with the terms Extended Release Film and System.
An intimate mixture of dry, finely divided drugs and/or chemicals that may be intended for internal or external use. (NCI)

A solid body of various weights and shapes, adapted for introduction into the rectal, vaginal, or urethral orifice of the human body; they usually melt, soften, or dissolve at body temperature.

A liquid dosage form that contains solid particles dispersed in a liquid vehicle. Note: A liquid is pourable; it flows and conforms to its container at room temperature. It displays Newtonian or pseudoplastic flow behavior.

CodeList.Name: Mode of Delivery

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist relevant to the mode of delivery of a fetus or neonate.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The delivery of a breech-presenting fetus, which is manually pulled through the birth canal.
Surgical delivery of one or more intrauterine fetuses though an abdominal incision.
Extraction of a fetus through the cervix using destructive surgical techniques.
Birth of the fetus through the vagina with the application of vacuum or forceps or any other instrument.
A vaginal birth in a woman with one or more previous cesarean births. (reVITALize)
Birth of the fetus through the vagina.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Mode of Delivery Terminology

CodeList.Name: Race As Collected

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist relevant to the race of an individual as collected on the case report form.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The native people of Australia.
A person having origins in the original peoples of sub-Saharan Africa and the United States.
A person having origins in the original peoples of sub-Saharan Africa and the Caribbean.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of sub-Saharan Africa.
The native people of Alaska.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment. (FDA)
The native people of North America.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Arabian peninsula and surrounding territories in the Middle East and northern Africa.
A person having origins in the original peoples of Asia and the United States.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Indian subcontinent.

A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (FDA)
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Bahamas.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Bangladesh.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Barbados.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Bhutan.
A person having origins in the original peoples of sub-Saharan Africa and Central America.
A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa. Terms such as "Haitian" or "Negro" can be used in addition to "Black or African American." (FDA)
A person having origins in the original peoples of sub-Saharan Africa and South America.
A person having origins in the original peoples of sub-Saharan Africa or the Caribbean.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Botswana.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Myanmar (formerly Burma).
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Cambodia (formerly Kampuchea).
The native people of the Caribbean.
The native people of Central America.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Central Asia.
The native people of the Mariana Islands, including the United States territories of Guam and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in Micronesia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of China.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Dominica.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Dominican Republic.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of East Asia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Eastern Europe.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of England.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Ethiopia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Philippines.
The native people of Greenland.
A person having origins in the original peoples of the United States territories of Guam and the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands in Micronesia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Guam.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Haiti.
The native people originating in China around the Yellow River or Hoang Ho.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Indonesia.
The native people inhabiting the territory spanning the Norton Sound on the Bering Sea to the Canadian border.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Ireland.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Iwo Jima.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Jamaica.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Japan.
The native people of the Western Cape in southern Africa.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South Korea.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Laos.
A person of Latin American descent.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Liberia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Madagascar.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Malaysia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Maldives.
The native people of New Zealand.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the countries surrounding the Mediterranean sea.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Melanesia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Micronesia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Middle East.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Mongolia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Namibia.

EnumeratedItem.CodedValue: NATIVE HAWAIIAN OR OTHER PACIFIC ISLANDER
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Denotes a person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands. The term covers particularly people who identify themselves as part-Hawaiian, Native Hawaiian, Guamanian or Chamorro, Carolinian, Samoan, Chuu. (FDA)
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii. (NCI)
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Nepal.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Nigeria.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North Africa.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Northern Europe.
Not provided or available.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Okinawa.
A person having origins in the original peoples of the Pacific Islands, but not Guam, Hawaii, the Mariana Islands or Samoa. (NCI)
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Pakistan.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Polynesia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Russia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Samoa. (NCI)
The native Yupik people inhabiting the coast of the Chukchi Peninsula in the far northeast of the Russian Federation and on St. Lawrence Island in Alaska.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Singapore.
The native people of South America.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the South Asia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Southeast Asia.

A person of mixed race, whose ancestry is from one or more of the naturalized racial groups of Southern Africa (typically Western European, South Asian, or Southeastern Asian) and one or more of the indigenous Southern African peoples.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Sri Lanka.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Taiwan.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Thailand.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Tobago.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Trinidad.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Viet Nam.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Western Asia.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the West Indies.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Western Europe.
A person having origins in the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa, and the Caribbean.
A person having origins in the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa, and Central America.
A person having origins in the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa, and South America.
Denotes a person with European, Middle Eastern, or North African ancestral origin who identifies, or is identified, as White. (FDA)
The native people inhabiting western, southwestern, and southcentral Alaska and the Russian Far East.
A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Zaire.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Collected Race Terminology

CodeList.Name: Serious Adverse Event Report Category

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the classification of a serious adverse event report.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Action(s) undertaken to modify by means of correction, addition, subtraction, or replacement.
Action(s) undertaken to void, negate, or invalidate.
Preceding all others in time or being as first made or performed.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Serious Adverse Event Report Category Response Terminology

CodeList.Name: Study Agent Dechallenge Reaction Response

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist relevant to the resultant reaction due to withdrawing, interrupting, or otherwise altering administration of study treatment.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Continued presence of an adverse event after decrease or change in dose, or withdrawal of the product/drug.
The outcome of decreasing the dose or discontinuation of the product/drug is not relevant in the current context.
Partial or complete abatement of an adverse event after decrease or change in dose, or withdrawal of the product/drug.
No information regarding the outcome of decreasing the dose or discontinuation of the product/drug.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Study Agent Dechallenge Reaction Response Terminology

CodeList.Name: Study Agent Rechallenge Reaction Response

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist relevant to the resultant reaction due to restarting or otherwise returning administration of study treatment to previous level, after a dechallenge event.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Failure of the product/drug, when reintroduced, to produce signs or symptoms similar to those observed when the product/drug was previously used.
The outcome of reintroduction of product/drug is not relevant in the current context.
Recurrence of similar or new signs and symptoms upon reintroduction of the product/drug.
No information regarding the outcome of reintroduction of product/drug.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Study Agent Rechallenge Reaction Response Terminology

CodeList.Name: Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Never/Current/Former Classification codelist created for CDASH Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time. (NCI)
Occurring prior to something else. (NCI)
Not ever; at no time in the past.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Substance Use Never/Current/Former Classification Terminology

CodeList.Name: Total Volume Administration Unit

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Total Volume Administration Unit codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A unit of mass equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a gram.
A unit of volume equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a liter.
A unit of mass equal to one millionth (1E-6) of a gram.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Total Volume Administration Unit Terminology

CodeList.Name: Unit for the Duration of Treatment Interruption

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Unit for Duration of Treatment Interruption codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A unit of measurement of time equal to 60 minutes.
A unit of measurement of time equal to 60 seconds.

The base unit of time in the International System of Units (SI) equal to the duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the cesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A unit of flow rate equal to one milliliter per minute.
A unit of substance flow rate equal to one millimole per day.

A means of delivering a defined dose of a therapeutic aerolized solution into either the upper or lower respiratory tract. Metered-dose inhalers or spray pumps are devices that provide a puff dose for delivery into either the oral or the nasal cavity.(NCI)

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Unit codelist created for CDASH Units for Planned Exposure codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A dosing measurement based on the capsule unit.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a kilogram, the kilogram being the base unit of mass in the International System of Units (SI).
A unit of mass equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a gram.
A unit of volume equal to one thousandth (1E-3) of a liter.

A means of delivering a defined dose of a therapeutic aerolized solution into either the upper or lower respiratory tract. Metered-dose inhalers or spray pumps are devices that provide a puff dose for delivery into either the oral or the nasal cavity.(NCI)
A dosing measurement based on the tablet unit.(NCI)
A unit of mass equal to one millionth (1E-6) of a gram.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Units for Planned Exposure Terminology

CodeList.Name: Vital Signs Position of Subject

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology subset of the CDISC SDTM Position codelist created for CDASH Vital Signs Position of Subject codelist. (NCI)

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: The state or act of one who sits; the posture of one who occupies a seat. (NCI)
The act of assuming or maintaining an erect upright position. (NCI)
A posterior recumbent body position whereby the person lies on its back and faces upward. (NCI)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC CDASH Vital Signs Position of Subject Terminology
